creditline: Gift of the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc.
description: 20 color snapshots of people inside a small red photo album with a white plastic binding; sheet with black and white images of photo albums bound into album as first page; see Components for descriptions of each photograph
image_copyright: © The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts%2C Inc. %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York
markings: on back of each photo, stamped in blue: [THE ESTATE / OF / ANDY WARHOL] and Andy Wahrol Foundation stamp; on back of a-m and q-t, stamped in black: [E214651]; on back of n-p, stamped in black: [E214641]; on spine and inside front cover, on stickers: [123]; on back cover, on sticker: [.60 / 62D]
text: Little Red Book #123 is a collection of Polaroids of members of Andy Warhol’s life and social circle. Some are known celebrities, others part of New York’s active art and club scene in the 1970s.  Warhol produced more than forty thousand Polaroids between 1970 and 1987. A small number of these images were organized by Warhol himself into more than one hundred Red Books. The twenty images here document the life and world of an artist in a way that challenges the notions of the carefully framed and lit portraits expected by the photography tradition.
title: Little Red Book
